page.title: 15THE FLORA OF EAST MERSEA
page.content: A survey of the flora in Cudmore Grove Country Park in June revealed the following: {FLOWERS: }Dandelions, Daisies, Buttercups, Red and White Clover, Clementine, Cow Parsley, Smooth Cats Ear and Red and White Campian were seen throughout the park. {TREES AND BUSHES:} Oak and Elderberry trees were seen all around the park,with Broom, Gorse, Hawthorn and Brambles near the edges of the park. {OTHER PLANTS:}Toadstools, Mushrooms, and other fungi were found near the trees; three types of Thistles were identified in the park, the Spear, the Slender and the Creeping Thistle; three sorts of Nettles could also be seen, Stinging Nettles and Red and White Dead Nettles.
